intro: Calystegia dahurica f. subvolubilis, commonly known as the Siberian morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is a perennial vine characterized by its slender, trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pale blue to white in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. Its rapid growth and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking to add vertical interest to their landscapes.
